author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Easy Node Deployment - [Revelar]
description: Para los nuevos SPO's y desarrolladores, la puesta en marcha de los nodos (no locales) de Cardano lleva demasiado tiempo.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is clear and concise, however, this proposal would be a better fit for an Open-source dev ecosystem challenge, as this problem statement is not relevant to how it will support independent SPO's to make the Cardano network globally sustainable. This proposal would be more important for developers who might be building something in Cardano like NFT's etc. The proposals goals would certainly add much more value to the Cardano ecosystem but the successful implementation of the proposal would not align with the goals of the current challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a detailed description of the proposer's skill sets and relevant experience for the implementation of the proposal.  Proposer's team looks to be having enough manpower and a skilled team to successfully implement the proposal. The budget breakdown is clear and the timeline looks reasonable. Also, the proposal has a weekly plan/roadmap and the required DevOps engineer for the implementation of the proposal. The execution plan of the proposal is very much clear so including this in an appropriate challenge would have made much more impact on this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal contains a clear roadmap that has weekly deliverables, also most importantly since the project is an open-source one, the weekly deliverables of the project can easily be tracked by the community from the Github repo. Would suggest to the proposer to add (in future proposals) KPI's on how the proposal would add more value to the independent SPO community so that the voters can understand the relevance of the proposal to the current challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely For new SPO's and developers, spinning up (non-local) Cardano nodes takes too much time.






It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief whereby to 
Create a secure & simple node deployment with open source configurations, security practices & monitoring.
 
This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by creating such a solution
 
  Key metrics  would be  number of users, no of wallets, no of fiat transactions, no of ADA transactions.
 

The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
   
Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more businesses who use the same solution

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by enabling small businesses to get on board.

I can say that this proposal adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0: Great initiative to create a tool where the creation on a stake pool becomes a breeze. I've seen multiple stake pools not being able to hold their head above the water because of everything that comes with it. By creating a node deployment the development of a stake pool beings a bit non-technical.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the project itself, we get what is required. We have a roadmap that explains in detail what is planned. Although 6weeks might be a short amount to set everything up so that it is understandable to a bigger audience. The team behind the proposal is surely qualified for the job. They present all the relevant skills needed for this. What I am wondering is how are you planning the budget? The team consists of 6 people but there is only funding requested for 60h for Developer operations? The proposal states to pay for the cloud service costs but I have a feeling that $5000 is not enough for this proposal?
f6_assessments.q2: The team provides us with all the necessary details to assess the progress of this proposal. We have a worked-out roadmap and a budget breakdown. They also convey that they will do surveys at each 3, 6, 10 months to follow the process of the deployment and evolvement of the developers using the GitHub node. They will provide the updated details on the GitHub page that are provided. Great proposal on something this is needed for global deployment.
